channel.title: My RS2 animation editor
channel.description:
Hello.
I have decided that I'm going to start building a very advanced animation editor/creator for the RS2 client.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eRii3RBjyHw[/youtube]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgUDTEUIZsY[/youtube]
[IMG]https://dl.dropbox.com/u/2428061/animation%20editor/3dicons.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2428061/animation%20editor/highlighting.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2428061/animation%20editor/1.PNG[/img]

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Okay turns out I was being dumb before. You skin name is wrong. A cluster would link a bone to a series of vertices (such “L lower arm”). Your “left arm” isn’t a skin, it’s just another cluster. In skeletal animations, bones are hierarchical. The left arm is an entire bone, containing other child bones. A skin is a total collection of clusters for an entire mesh (so “entire body” is the only skin in that list).

Read full topic

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Edit: nevermind, I may be wrong. Can you release your application so I can play around with it a bit?

Read full topic

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Harry Lord Harry
item.description:
@Lord_Harry wrote:

The ‘skins’ do not represent bones themselves. A ‘skin’ contains groups of bones, not groups of vertices. So in other words, a skin contains groups of groups of vertices.

For example, there is a ‘skin’ which controls the entire body. This skin contains every bone (vertex group) on the character.

I admit ‘skin’ probably isn’t the best term to use, but for now it will do until I find the correct term. The only other appropriate term I can think of is ‘bone group’. If you have any other name ideas feel free to suggest them.

Read full topic

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Okay well since no one else mentioned it, you probably should read up a bit more on how digital animations work. Your “skins” are probably more appropriately called “joints” or “bones.” In skeletal animation, a bone or cluster is a group of vertices (optionally weighted) which follow some sequence of transforms directed by an animation. In your videos, you rotate groups of vertices after selecting a “skin,” which is why I’m pretty sure that’s supposed to be a bone/cluster. A group of clusters is called a skin/a group of bones is called a skeleton, whatever naming you prefer.

Read full topic

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

The seq.dat file is the animations… the individual transform sets and frames are not limited to an individual animation, but yes are auxiliary of course. Besides that, you had not indicated this handled current RS animations, but if you say so… regardless, this board is for questions and simple discussion, not show-off-style threads. peter’s thread was OK because it was a release itself. Suit yourself, I suppose. I’m not a moderator but I couldn’t help but think this wasn’t meant to be posted here.

Read full topic

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Harry Lord Harry
item.description:
@Lord_Harry wrote:

[quote=“veer, post:3, topic:451242”]Let me attempt to break this down for you.
This board is dedicated to modern RS clients and work surrounding them. Work focusing on private servers and the like are expected to be posted on moparisthebest.com, not here. Peterbjornx’s map editor at the time of release worked on then-current RS2 maps (early March 2009)… see his post:

I know , this is a bit RSPS, but its got to do with the client and its formats, the format hasnt changed in the latest RS2 Build

Here is the animation file format in 377:

[code=java]package jagex.graphics.media3d.animation;

import jagex.io.Buffer;
import jagex.resource.Archive;

public class Animation {

public static void load(Archive archive) {
Buffer data = new Buffer(archive.extract(“seq.dat”, null));
count = data.read_u16();
if (animations == null)
animations = new Animation[count];
for (int j = 0; j < count; j++) {
if (animations[j] == null)
animations[j] = new Animation();
animations[j].decode(data);
}

}

public int duration(int frame_ptr) {
int k = frame_durations[frame_ptr];
if (k == 0) {
Frame frame = Frame.lookup(primary_frames[frame_ptr]);
if (frame != null)
k = frame_durations[frame_ptr] = frame.duration;
}
if (k == 0)
k = 1;
return k;
}

public void decode(Buffer data) {
do {
int i = data.read_u8();
if (i == 0)
break;
if (i == 1) {
num_frames = data.read_u8();
primary_frames = new int[num_frames];
secondary_frames = new int[num_frames];
frame_durations = new int[num_frames];
for (int j = 0; j < num_frames; j++) {
primary_frames[j] = data.read_u16();
secondary_frames[j] = data.read_u16();
if (secondary_frames[j] == 65535)
secondary_frames[j] = -1;
frame_durations[j] = data.read_u16();
}

  } else if (i == 2)
    loop_delta = data.read_u16();
  else if (i == 3) {
    int k = data.read_u8();
    interleave_order = new int[k + 1];
    for (int l = 0; l < k; l++)
      interleave_order[l] = data.read_u8();

    interleave_order[k] = 0x98967f;
  } else if (i == 4)
    stretches = true;
  else if (i == 5)
    priority = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 6)
    player_replacement_shield = data.read_u16();
  else if (i == 7)
    player_replacement_weapon = data.read_u16();
  else if (i == 8)
    max_loops = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 9)
    /* when animating, 0 -> block walking, 1 -> yield to walking, 2 -> interleave with walking */
    precedence_animating = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 10)
    /* when walking, 0 -> block walking, 1 -> yield to walking, 2 -> never used... interleave with walking? */
    precedence_walking = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 11)
    replay_mode = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 12)
    /* never used */
    anInt308 = data.read_32();
  else
    System.out.println("Error unrecognised seq config code: " + i);
} while (true);
if (num_frames == 0) {
  num_frames = 1;
  primary_frames = new int[1];
  primary_frames[0] = -1;
  secondary_frames = new int[1];
  secondary_frames[0] = -1;
  frame_durations = new int[1];
  frame_durations[0] = -1;
}
if (precedence_animating == -1)
  if (interleave_order != null)
    precedence_animating = 2;
  else
    precedence_animating = 0;
if (precedence_walking == -1) {
  if (interleave_order != null) {
    precedence_walking = 2;
    return;
  }
  precedence_walking = 0;
}

}

public Animation() {
loop_delta = -1;
stretches = false;
priority = 5;
player_replacement_shield = -1;
player_replacement_weapon = -1;
max_loops = 99;
precedence_animating = -1;
precedence_walking = -1;
replay_mode = 2;
}

public static int count;
public static Animation animations[];
public int num_frames;
public int primary_frames[];
public int secondary_frames[];
public int frame_durations[];
public int loop_delta;
public int interleave_order[];
public boolean stretches;
public int priority;
public int player_replacement_shield;
public int player_replacement_weapon;
public int max_loops;
public int precedence_animating;
public int precedence_walking;
public int replay_mode;
public int anInt308;
}[/code]
This is likely the exact same format you’re dealing with, right? Unfortunately it’s out-of-date. RS uses a changed format for animations now (and has for a while), so this thread has no purpose here, unlike peterbjornx’s.
Aside from that, this isn’t even a release of source code – merely a link to videos showing off your work. So, even had this been done with a current client, you’re still in the wrong board.[/quote]

Actually this editor is cross-compatible, so it will be able to decode (and encode) many animation formats (including the current one).

Also, the code which you posted is actually for the seq file. Which only manages which order the frames are played in for the different animations. This editor is not related to that, it edits the frames themselves.

The plan is to release it once its ready, so people can make animations or use it as a viewer to view animations from the current runescape cache. (I don’t think there are any rules which state that you must provide source code.)

Read full topic

item.title: My RS2 animation editor
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

Let me attempt to break this down for you.
This board is dedicated to modern RS clients and work surrounding them. Work focusing on private servers and the like are expected to be posted on moparisthebest.com, not here. Peterbjornx’s map editor at the time of release worked on then-current RS2 maps (early March 2009)… see his post:

3D Map Editor for unedited RS2 clients[OpenSource/GPL]

I know , this is a bit RSPS, but its got to do with the client and its formats, the format hasnt changed in the latest RS2 Build

Here is the animation file format in 377:

[code=java]package jagex.graphics.media3d.animation;

import jagex.io.Buffer;
import jagex.resource.Archive;

public class Animation {

public static void load(Archive archive) {
Buffer data = new Buffer(archive.extract(“seq.dat”, null));
count = data.read_u16();
if (animations == null)
animations = new Animation[count];
for (int j = 0; j < count; j++) {
if (animations[j] == null)
animations[j] = new Animation();
animations[j].decode(data);
}

}

public int duration(int frame_ptr) {
int k = frame_durations[frame_ptr];
if (k == 0) {
Frame frame = Frame.lookup(primary_frames[frame_ptr]);
if (frame != null)
k = frame_durations[frame_ptr] = frame.duration;
}
if (k == 0)
k = 1;
return k;
}

public void decode(Buffer data) {
do {
int i = data.read_u8();
if (i == 0)
break;
if (i == 1) {
num_frames = data.read_u8();
primary_frames = new int[num_frames];
secondary_frames = new int[num_frames];
frame_durations = new int[num_frames];
for (int j = 0; j < num_frames; j++) {
primary_frames[j] = data.read_u16();
secondary_frames[j] = data.read_u16();
if (secondary_frames[j] == 65535)
secondary_frames[j] = -1;
frame_durations[j] = data.read_u16();
}

  } else if (i == 2)
    loop_delta = data.read_u16();
  else if (i == 3) {
    int k = data.read_u8();
    interleave_order = new int[k + 1];
    for (int l = 0; l < k; l++)
      interleave_order[l] = data.read_u8();

    interleave_order[k] = 0x98967f;
  } else if (i == 4)
    stretches = true;
  else if (i == 5)
    priority = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 6)
    player_replacement_shield = data.read_u16();
  else if (i == 7)
    player_replacement_weapon = data.read_u16();
  else if (i == 8)
    max_loops = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 9)
    /* when animating, 0 -> block walking, 1 -> yield to walking, 2 -> interleave with walking */
    precedence_animating = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 10)
    /* when walking, 0 -> block walking, 1 -> yield to walking, 2 -> never used... interleave with walking? */
    precedence_walking = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 11)
    replay_mode = data.read_u8();
  else if (i == 12)
    /* never used */
    anInt308 = data.read_32();
  else
    System.out.println("Error unrecognised seq config code: " + i);
} while (true);
if (num_frames == 0) {
  num_frames = 1;
  primary_frames = new int[1];
  primary_frames[0] = -1;
  secondary_frames = new int[1];
  secondary_frames[0] = -1;
  frame_durations = new int[1];
  frame_durations[0] = -1;
}
if (precedence_animating == -1)
  if (interleave_order != null)
    precedence_animating = 2;
  else
    precedence_animating = 0;
if (precedence_walking == -1) {
  if (interleave_order != null) {
    precedence_walking = 2;
    return;
  }
  precedence_walking = 0;
}

}

public Animation() {
loop_delta = -1;
stretches = false;
priority = 5;
player_replacement_shield = -1;
player_replacement_weapon = -1;
max_loops = 99;
precedence_animating = -1;
precedence_walking = -1;
replay_mode = 2;
}

public static int count;
public static Animation animations[];
public int num_frames;
public int primary_frames[];
public int secondary_frames[];
public int frame_durations[];
public int loop_delta;
public int interleave_order[];
public boolean stretches;
public int priority;
public int player_replacement_shield;
public int player_replacement_weapon;
public int max_loops;
public int precedence_animating;
public int precedence_walking;
public int replay_mode;
public int anInt308;
}[/code]
This is likely the exact same format you’re dealing with, right? Unfortunately it’s out-of-date. RS uses a changed format for animations now (and has for a while), so this thread has no purpose here, unlike peterbjornx’s.
Aside from that, this isn’t even a release of source code – merely a link to videos showing off your work. So, even had this been done with a current client, you’re still in the wrong board.

Read full topic
